#labels Featured
How to use photos and galleries in your templates

= Introduction =

I've created a set of templates to use as a starting point. These templates coincide with the generic views defined in `urls.py`.

*Note:* The sample templates are now included with 0.4 release and with the trunk revision.

= Installing the sample templates =

Create a base template with the filename "base.html" with blocks defined for "title" and "content" and define two `PhotoSizes`, "thumbnail" and "display".

= Additional Examples =

Inserting images into your other page templates is easy. I recommend building a set of template snippets and css styles and using [http://www.djangoproject.com/documentation/templates_python/#inclusion-tags inclusion tags] to keep a unified look throughout your site.

== 1. Display a Photo ==

to display a image in a custom view (assumes that you have a `PhotoSize` defined with the name "display" and a `Photo` with the title "My photo" in the database):

{{{
from django.shortcuts import render_to_response
from django_apps.photologue.models import Photo

def view_photo(request):
    photo = Photo.objects.get(title="My photo")
    return render_to_response('view_photo.html', {'photo': photo})
}}}

In the template:

{{{
 
{% extends "my_base_template.html" %}

{% block title %}My Photo{% endblock %}

{% block content %}

<h1>My Photo</h1>
<a href="{{ photo.get_absolute_url }}"><img src="{{ photo.get_display_url }}" alt="{{ photo.title }}"/></a>

{% endblock %}

}}}


== 1. Display a Gallery ==

to display a image in a custom view (assumes that you have a `PhotoSize` defined with the name "thumbnail" and a `Gallery` with the title "My gallery" in the database):

{{{
from django.shortcuts import render_to_response
from django_apps.photologue.models import Gallery

def view_gallery(request):
    gallery = Gallery.objects.get(title="My gallery")
    return render_to_response('view_gallery.html', {'gallery': gallery})
}}}

In the template:

{{{
 
{% extends "my_base_template.html" %}

{% block title %}My Gallery{% endblock %}

{% block content %}

<h1>My Gallery</h1>
<div class="photo-gallery">
<h2>{{ gallery.title }}</h2>
{% for photo in gallery.photos.all %}
    <a href="{{ photo.get_absolute_url }}"><img src="{{ photo.get_display_url }}" alt="{{ photo.title }}"/></a>
{% endfor %}
</div>

{% endblock %}

}}}
